alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montgomery, northeastern Chester, west central Philadelphia and northeastern Delaware Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Royersford, or 19 miles north of West Chester, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Norristown, Pottstown, Phoenixville, West Norriton, East Norriton, Conshohocken, Collegeville, Royersford, Narberth, Trappe, Schwenksville, Germantown, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Spring Mount, Valley Forge, Broomall and Plymouth Meeting. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 318 and 334. Northeast Extension near mile marker 21. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 338. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
